definition: currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: But developers have little incentive to build less-profitable units for low-income households.
sentences.chinese: 但開發商不願爲低收入家庭建造低利潤的單元房。
他正在尋購一套單元房。
他們有一套舒服的單元房。

sentences.english: We have one or two and three bedroom apartments available.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一居或兩居和三居室的單元房。

sentences.english: Although the apartment is not big enough, it can meet the young people's need.
sentences.chinese: 那套單元房不大，但是能滿足小倆口的需要。

sentences.english: I should require that your company provide me with an apartment.
sentences.chinese: 本人要求貴公司給我提供一套單元房。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang bought a flat of five rooms.
sentences.chinese: 王先生買了一套有五間屋子的單元房。

sentences.english: Developers are currently not allowed to pre-sell units in new buildings until the roof is on.
sentences.chinese: 現在房子封頂前不允許開發商們預售單元房。

sentences.english: Units are now being marketed at heavily reduced prices.
sentences.chinese: 如今，單元房正在以大幅縮水的價格被推銷給客戶。

sentences.english: Nidal Malik Hasan went to his next-door neighbor at the rundown apartment complex where he rented a one-bedroom unit and gave her most of his belongings, saying he would not need them any more.
sentences.chinese: 他在這座破舊的公寓樓裏租有一個一居室的單元房。

sentences.english: They moved into a new apartment.
sentences.chinese: 他們搬進一套新單元房。

sentences.english: She is buying a flat close to her office.
sentences.chinese: 她正在購買一套靠近她辦公室的單元房。

sentences.english: Many large old houses have now been converted into flats.
sentences.chinese: 許多舊的大房子都己改建成了單元房。
